mergeResults.content: Identity: 40-year-old former headman of Lisle; skilled rider with possible military background; stoic, pragmatic, stubborn to the point of self-destruction. State: Newly awakened immensely powerful Mage-Gift (unknown type, possibly Firestarting)—burned open mental channels cause white-hot agony, blurred vision, teetering sanity; Gift-shock severe; physically exhausted but forcing himself through sheer willpower. Arc: Witnessed entire village destroyed and people carried off during bandit attack; believes others caused destruction—doesn't yet fully accept he did it himself; driven by duty to warn Haven despite trauma; initially dismissed Senta as 'insufferable horse,' called her for mercy killing. Relationship with Senta: Chosen by her—bond snapped into place when their eyes locked; her unconditional love and mental bridges stabilized his fracturing mind enough to survive; accepts bond pragmatically ('I'm in no position to argue') but resists her care ('If you tire, I'll drag you'); their connection allows mind-speech though it pains his ragged channels. Evidence gathered: Red robes hidden under bandit clothing; suspects organized sect, not simple bandits; tracks lead toward Menmellith.

Identity: 40-year-old former headman of Lisle; skilled rider with possible military background from border proximity; knows Karsite features, tactics, old practices (blood magic ritual sacrifice); stoic, pragmatic, stubborn to point of self-destruction. State: Newly awakened immensely powerful Mage-Gift (unknown type, possibly Firestarting)—burned open mental channels cause white-hot agony, blurred vision; underwent four-day unconscious journey to Haven due to Gift-shock severity; now at Haven Healers' Collegium, unconscious but stable. Arc: Witnessed entire village destroyed and people carried off during bandit attack; memories of destruction still blocked/suppressed—doesn't yet fully accept he did it himself; gathered evidence (red robes hidden under bandit clothing, tracks toward Menmellith) suggesting organized Karsite sect; driven by duty to warn Haven despite trauma. Relationship with Senta: Chosen by her—bond snapped into place when their eyes locked; shifted from resistance ('insufferable horse,' called for mercy killing) to full acceptance and partnership (affectionate nuzzle, 'we face it together'); her unconditional love and mental bridges stabilized his fracturing mind enough to survive; their connection allows mind-speech though it pains his ragged channels; ordered her to knock him out if he loses control—accepts danger he poses. Believed Herald-Mages were historical fiction before this experience.

Identity: 40-year-old former headman of Lisle; skilled rider with possible military background from border proximity; knows Karsite features, tactics, old practices (blood magic ritual sacrifice); stoic, pragmatic, stubborn to point of self-destruction. State: Newly awakened immensely powerful Mage-Gift—power capable of leveling villages, not seen since Vanyel's era; burned open mental channels cause white-hot agony, blurred vision; now at Haven Healers' Collegium in assigned containment cottage, stable. Untrained Mindspeech capable of forcing through trained shields. Arc: Witnessed entire village destroyed and people carried off during bandit attack; memories of destruction still blocked/suppressed—doesn't yet fully accept he did it himself; gathered evidence (red robes hidden under bandit clothing, tracks toward Menmellith) suggesting organized Karsite sect; driven by duty to warn Haven despite trauma. Complete mind-merge with Talia gave him all her memories, training, state secrets, intimate knowledge; can use her shielding techniques and protocol; occasionally slips into her mannerisms/authority. Taking on strategic leadership role using combined knowledge of headman experience and Talia's expertise. Relationship with Senta: Chosen by her—bond snapped into place when their eyes locked; shifted from resistance to full acceptance and partnership (affectionate nuzzle, 'we face it together'); her unconditional love and mental bridges stabilized his fracturing mind enough to survive; their connection allows mind-speech though it pains his ragged channels; ordered her to knock him out if he loses control—accepts danger he poses. Instinctive distrust of Karsites from decades fighting border raids, but assessed Alberich's loyalty pragmatically. Believed Herald-Mages were historical fiction before this experience.
